Doc: Denotes the method of collateral value allocation

Source.Contents:
/#
 Denotes the method of collateral value allocation
 #/
enum FpML5.reporting.CollateralValueAllocationEnum {
    # The amount that is being allocated from a buffer account. A buffer account is meant to hold funds that the FCM can use to cover the liability of any client. In effect, the FCM has provided funds that are available to meet its customers’ needs and the DCO may use such collateral to meet a default by a customer to the same extent as if the customer provided the collateral.
    Buffer 
    # The full amount is being allocated
    Full 
    # The allocated amount is an excess over the margin requirement
    ExcessOverMargin 
    # The allocated amount for margin requirement
    Margin 

}

Buffer.Doc: The amount that is being allocated from a buffer account. A buffer account is meant to hold funds that the FCM can use to cover the liability of any client. In effect, the FCM has provided funds that are available to meet its customers’ needs and the DCO may use such collateral to meet a default by a customer to the same extent as if the customer provided the collateral.
Buffer.Name: Buffer

Full.Doc: The full amount is being allocated
Full.Name: Full

ExcessOverMargin.Doc: The allocated amount is an excess over the margin requirement
ExcessOverMargin.Name: ExcessOverMargin

Margin.Doc: The allocated amount for margin requirement
Margin.Name: Margin
